1st, let me re-evaluate the proposed new attacks of Fire Elemental:
at experience level 4, giant fireball becames an attack.  Alternate of 
that would be giant starburst.  At exp level 6 (or maybe higher), 
suicide attack becomes a possiblity.  The amount of energy put into 
that single attack would be equal all the magic energy plus 1/10 the 
health converted into energy.  The idea behind the suicide attack is 
you are facing comething lots more powerfull than any other team 
member.  You would summon your fire elemental for the sole purpose of 
taking the opponent out.  This would be usefull for some of my 
'Torture' scenarios.  In theory, you wouldn't/shouldn't let any of 
your hired fire elementals use this attack.  To make it fair, a fire 
elemental has to be reasonable close to an enemy to use it.

-- In gladiator@y..., "Ricky Der" <TheLegendaryLight@w...> wrote:
> Still, i think there should be some limits to chars that really 
shouldn't 
> use it, and increase the less fortuante characters stats, i just see 
it
> boring sometimes to have max all stats on a mage, or cleric, or elf, 
that
> could kill almost anything. there should be caps that increase per 
lv, just
> to make things interesting.

Actually, I would prefer dual dependance between exp level and other 
stats.  Exp level would only increase the potency of an attack, while 
another stat would increase the range.
 
> I like the new fire elemental and slime recommendations, but don't 
make them
> too powerful

Ideally, you would want to use a pretty fast character (I confess to 
using the Soldier's charge attack to help outrun opponents) or a 
character with long range attacks (archer comes to mind) to attack 
anything with a suicide attack.

I don't remember if I said this before, but I propose giving slime an 
attack called 'Digestion'.  They would shoot digestive fluids at you.

Skeletons - Has anyone ever tried to use tunnel attack with a skeleton 
of experience level 10 or higher?  It might as well be as bad as a 
mage's teleportation.  I would propose an alternate to tunnel called 
'Underground'.  The Skeleton would stay underground and walk around 
everywhere until you make him go above ground.  Why not allow 6 normal 
 skeletons to combine and form a 'Giant Skeleton'?

Ghost - I would propose an attack called 'Phase Out'.  Basically, 
every attack aimed at a ghost would just pass right through.  While 
this attack is on, a ghost can use any magic potions, use teleporters, 
eat food, etc.  A cleric could still kill the ghost using 'Turn 
Undead'.  This attack would come at experience level 8.  At experience 
level 4 or higher, a ghost could 'Possess' another character's body 
for a brief period of time, provided the ghost has a higher experience 
level.  When the ghost leaves the body, it has perfect health and 
fully charged with magical energy, the extra health and energy would 
come from the body of the possessed character.
> 
> I got a good special attack for the mage, Invisibility, the mage can 
cast
> it, then dissapear, until the mage attacks something, while all 
undead
> creatures can have the special skill, see invis, where they can see.

Actually, this would be a great idea.  Letting all the undead see 
anything invisible.

Orc Captain - ok, how about giving him the power to walk on water.  
Also, give him the proposed "throw net' attack which paralyzes an 
enemy.  Another attack for him would be 'Poison dart'.  Once you get 
him, you keep losing so many health points constantly until the 
character dies or you finish the scenario.

I think I have covered all of the hired character classes by now, 
giving everyone 3 attacks.  Oh yea, thief.  I would propose adding 
'Remote bomb' as alternate to 'Drop Bomb'.  You could drop off lots of 
remote bombs, but you would have to use a specific keystroke to denote 
them all at once.

I will have to work on coming off with more attacks for 'Giant 
Skeleton' and 'Golem'.
